titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Barry Pink, [18. 3. 1951]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Aus einer Kopie in 'The Ray Monk Archive, The Random House Group Archive & Library, Rushden', Signatur: ‘Monk Ray, Wittgenstein Archive, Box 15’.
Abschrift und Kommentar Gabriel Citron, Kommentar Brian McGuinness, Scan in BA

div.p: Would you be so very kind as to send me one of my note-books to the above address? The one I mean stands on a shelf of my ‘book-case’; it is roughly quarto size, about ½ inch thick, or less, it has flexible black covers. If this isn’t on the shelf, there’s another one with cardboard covers black & white marbled & a white lable (like a copy book). I don’t mean the fat one that looks like a ledger & has a red back. I’d prefer the black flexible one.
I’m a good deal better than when you saw me last.

I hope you’re moderately
well. If Smythies is still about, please give him my good wishes & also to Father Pepler.
